Collecting colorlog (from optuna)
  Downloading colorlog-6.10.1-py3-none-any.whl.metadata (11 kB)
Requirement already satisfied: numpy in /usr/local/lib/python3.12/dist-packages (from optuna) (1.26.4)
Requirement already satisfied: packaging>=20.0 in /usr/local/lib/python3.12/dist-packages (from optuna) (25.0)
Requirement already satisfied: sqlalchemy>=1.4.2 in /usr/local/lib/python3.12/dist-packages (from optuna) (2.0.44)
Requirement already satisfied: tqdm in /usr/local/lib/python3.12/dist-packages (from optuna) (4.67.1)
Requirement already satisfied: PyYAML in /usr/local/lib/python3.12/dist-packages (from optuna) (6.0.3)
Requirement already satisfied: Mako in /usr/local/lib/python3.12/dist-packages (from alembic>=1.5.0->optuna) (1.3.10)
Requirement already satisfied: typing-extensions>=4.12 in /usr/local/lib/python3.12/dist-packages (from alembic>=1.5.0->optuna) (4.15.0)
Requirement already satisfied: greenlet>=1 in /usr/local/lib/python3.12/dist-packages (from sqlalchemy>=1.4.2->optuna) (3.2.4)
Requirement already satisfied: MarkupSafe>=0.9.2 in /usr/local/lib/python3.12/dist-packages (from Mako->alembic>=1.5.0->optuna) (3.0.3)
Downloading optuna-4.5.0-py3-none-any.whl (400 kB)
    400.9/400.9 kB 8.8 MB/s eta 0:00:00
Downloading colorlog-6.10.1-py3-none-any.whl (11 kB)
Installing collected packages: colorlog, optuna
Successfully installed colorlog-6.10.1 optuna-4.5.0





















In[]:






# ===============================
# Spark -> Aggregation -> Pandas -> LGBM + Optuna + ARIMA
# Train: 2015-01 .. 2018-12
# Test (holdout): 2019-01 .. 2019-12
# ===============================

import math, json, warnings, time
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import optuna
import lightgbm as lgb
from statsmodels.tsa.arima.model import ARIMA
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error, mean_absolute_error, r2_score
from tqdm import tqdm

# Spark imports
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.functions import (
    col, to_date, regexp_replace, unix_timestamp, dayofweek, month, year, sin, cos, lit,
    sum as _sum, avg as _avg, count as _count, stddev as _stddev, countDistinct,
    when, expr, max as _max, min as _min, lag
)
from pyspark.sql.types import DoubleType, IntegerType
from pyspark.sql.window import Window

# -------------------------
# 0) Spark init & data load
# -------------------------
spark = SparkSession.builder \
    .appName("agg_to_pandas_lgbm_arima_fixed") \
    .config("spark.sql.shuffle.partitions", "200") \
    .getOrCreate()

# --- load data (adapt paths to your environment) ---
import kagglehub
path = kagglehub.dataset_download("computingvictor/transactions-fraud-datasets")
transaction_data = f"{path}/transactions_data.csv"
mcc_codes_data = f"{path}/mcc_codes.json"

with open(mcc_codes_data, "r") as f:
    mcc_dict = json.load(f)
mcc = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(mcc_dict, orient="index", columns=["description"]).reset_index().rename(columns={"index":"mcc_code"})
mcc_spark = spark.createDataFrame(mcc)

td_spark = spark.read.csv(transaction_data, header=True, inferSchema=True)

# -------------------------
# 1) Transaction-level FE (Spark)
# -------------------------
LABEL_COL = "amount"
td_spark = td_spark.withColumn(LABEL_COL, regexp_replace(col(LABEL_COL), "\\$", ""))
td_spark = td_spark.withColumn(LABEL_COL, col(LABEL_COL).cast(DoubleType()))
td_spark = td_spark.withColumn("date", to_date(col("date")))

df = td_spark.join(mcc_spark, td_spark.mcc == mcc_spark.mcc_code, "left")

cols_to_drop = ["id", "use_chip", "merchant_city", "merchant_state", "zip", "mcc", "errors", "mcc_code"]
for c in cols_to_drop:
    if c in df.columns:
        df = df.drop(c)

# add year/month/ym at transaction level
df = df.withColumn("year", year(col("date")).cast(IntegerType()))
df = df.withColumn("month", month(col("date")).cast(IntegerType()))
df = df.withColumn("ym", (col("year") * 100 + col("month")).cast(IntegerType()))

df = df.withColumn("date_timestamp", unix_timestamp(col("date")).cast(DoubleType()))
df = df.withColumn("day_of_week", dayofweek(col("date")).cast(IntegerType()))
df = df.withColumn("is_refund", when(col(LABEL_COL) < 0, 1.0).otherwise(0.0).cast(DoubleType()))
df = df.withColumn("description_clean", regexp_replace(col("description"), "[ ,:\\[\\]\\{\\}]", "_"))

# transaction-level log target for client encoding
df = df.withColumn("log_amount_sum_tx", when(col(LABEL_COL) >= 0, col(LABEL_COL)).otherwise(0.0))
df = df.withColumn("log_amount_sum_tx", expr("log(1 + log_amount_sum_tx)"))

# filter to relevant period (post-break)
df = df.filter((col("date") >= "2015-01-01") & (col("date") <= "2019-12-31")).cache()
print("Transactions rows after date filter:", df.count())

# -------------------------
# 2) Monthly aggregation per merchant (Spark)
# -------------------------
group_cols = ["merchant_id", "year", "month"]

agg = df.groupBy(*group_cols).agg(
    _sum(LABEL_COL).alias("amount_sum"),
    _count("*").alias("tx_count"),
    _avg(LABEL_COL).alias("amount_avg"),
    _stddev(LABEL_COL).alias("amount_stddev"),
    _avg("is_refund").alias("refund_rate"),
    countDistinct("description_clean").alias("desc_count")
)

agg = agg.fillna({"amount_stddev": 0.0})
agg = agg.withColumn("ym", (col("year") * 100 + col("month")).cast(IntegerType()))

# cyclic temporal features
from math import pi
agg = agg.withColumn("month_sin", sin(2 * pi * col("month") / lit(12)))
agg = agg.withColumn("month_cos", cos(2 * pi * col("month") / lit(12)))

min_year = agg.agg({"year":"min"}).collect()[0][0]
agg = agg.withColumn("year_norm", (col("year") - lit(min_year)).cast(DoubleType()))

# aggregated log target
agg = agg.withColumn("log_amount_sum", when(col("amount_sum") >= 0, col("amount_sum")).otherwise(0.0))
agg = agg.withColumn("log_amount_sum", expr("log(1 + log_amount_sum)"))

# -------------------------
# 3) Lags / rollings / trend in Spark (monthly per merchant)
# -------------------------
window_spec = Window.partitionBy("merchant_id").orderBy("ym")

# Lags
agg = agg.withColumn("tx_count_lag1", lag("tx_count", 1).over(window_spec))
agg = agg.withColumn("tx_count_lag2", lag("tx_count", 2).over(window_spec))
agg = agg.withColumn("tx_count_lag3", lag("tx_count", 3).over(window_spec))

agg = agg.withColumn("amount_avg_lag1", lag("amount_avg", 1).over(window_spec))
agg = agg.withColumn("amount_avg_lag2", lag("amount_avg", 2).over(window_spec))
agg = agg.withColumn("amount_avg_lag3", lag("amount_avg", 3).over(window_spec))

agg = agg.withColumn("amount_stddev_lag1", lag("amount_stddev", 1).over(window_spec))
agg = agg.withColumn("refund_rate_lag1", lag("refund_rate", 1).over(window_spec))
agg = agg.withColumn("desc_count_lag1", lag("desc_count", 1).over(window_spec))

agg = agg.withColumn("log_amount_sum_lag1", lag("log_amount_sum", 1).over(window_spec))
agg = agg.withColumn("log_amount_sum_lag2", lag("log_amount_sum", 2).over(window_spec))
agg = agg.withColumn("log_amount_sum_lag3", lag("log_amount_sum", 3).over(window_spec))
agg = agg.withColumn("log_amount_sum_lag12", lag("log_amount_sum", 12).over(window_spec))
agg = agg.withColumn("tx_count_lag12", lag("tx_count", 12).over(window_spec))

# rolling windows (exclude current)
window_roll3 = Window.partitionBy("merchant_id").orderBy("ym").rowsBetween(-3, -1)
agg = agg.withColumn("amount_avg_roll3", _avg("amount_avg").over(window_roll3))
agg = agg.withColumn("tx_count_roll3", _avg("tx_count").over(window_roll3))

window_roll6 = Window.partitionBy("merchant_id").orderBy("ym").rowsBetween(-6, -1)
agg = agg.withColumn("amount_avg_roll6", _avg("amount_avg").over(window_roll6))
agg = agg.withColumn("tx_count_roll6", _avg("tx_count").over(window_roll6))

window_roll12 = Window.partitionBy("merchant_id").orderBy("ym").rowsBetween(-12, -1)
agg = agg.withColumn("amount_avg_roll12", _avg("amount_avg").over(window_roll12))
agg = agg.withColumn("tx_count_roll12", _avg("tx_count").over(window_roll12))

agg = agg.withColumn("log_amount_sum_roll12", _avg("log_amount_sum").over(window_roll12))

# trend and ratios
agg = agg.withColumn("amount_trend",
    when(col("amount_avg_lag1").isNotNull(),
         col("amount_avg_lag1") - lag("amount_avg", 2).over(window_spec)).otherwise(0.0))

agg = agg.withColumn("amount_growth_1_2", (col("amount_avg_lag1") + lit(1e-6)) / (col("amount_avg_lag2") + lit(1e-6)))
agg = agg.withColumn("amount_diff_1_2", col("amount_avg_lag1") - col("amount_avg_lag2"))

# fillna for lag/roll features
lag_cols = [c for c in agg.columns if any(k in c for k in ("lag","roll","trend","growth","diff"))]
fill_map = {c: 0.0 for c in lag_cols}
agg = agg.fillna(fill_map)

agg = agg.cache()
print("Monthly aggregated rows (after features):", agg.count())

# -------------------------
# 4) DEFINE SPLITS AND CLIENT AGGREGATES (no leakage)
# -------------------------
train_ym_max = 2018*100 + 12
holdout_ym_min = 2019*100 + 1
holdout_ym_max = 2019*100 + 12

train_agg = agg.filter(col("ym") <= train_ym_max).cache()
holdout_agg = agg.filter((col("ym") >= holdout_ym_min) & (col("ym") <= holdout_ym_max)).cache()

print("train_agg rows:", train_agg.count(), "holdout_agg rows:", holdout_agg.count())

# client aggregates calculated from transactions up to train_date_max (to avoid leakage)
train_date_max = "2018-12-31"
train_transactions_for_client = df.filter(col("date") <= lit(train_date_max)).cache()

client_stats = train_transactions_for_client.groupBy("client_id").agg(
    _avg("log_amount_sum_tx").alias("client_mean_tx"),
    _stddev("log_amount_sum_tx").alias("client_std_tx"),
    _count("*").alias("client_tx_count")
).fillna({"client_std_tx": 0.0})

tx_with_client = train_transactions_for_client.join(client_stats, "client_id", "left")
client_agg_df = tx_with_client.groupBy("merchant_id","ym").agg(
    _avg("client_mean_tx").alias("avg_client_mean_tx"),
    _avg("client_std_tx").alias("avg_client_std_tx"),
    _avg("client_tx_count").alias("avg_client_tx_count")
)

# join to train and holdout
train_joined = train_agg.join(client_agg_df, ["merchant_id","ym"], "left").fillna({
    "avg_client_mean_tx":0.0,"avg_client_std_tx":0.0,"avg_client_tx_count":0.0
})
holdout_joined = holdout_agg.join(client_agg_df, ["merchant_id","ym"], "left").fillna({
    "avg_client_mean_tx":0.0,"avg_client_std_tx":0.0,"avg_client_tx_count":0.0
})

# -------------------------
# 5) Convert aggregated tables to Pandas
# -------------------------
train_pd = train_joined.toPandas().fillna(0.0).reset_index(drop=True)
holdout_pd = holdout_joined.toPandas().fillna(0.0).reset_index(drop=True)

print("Converted to pandas: train rows", len(train_pd), "holdout rows", len(holdout_pd))

# -------------------------
# 6) Feature list (ensure existence)
# -------------------------
feature_cols = [
    "tx_count_lag1","tx_count_lag2","tx_count_lag3",
    "amount_avg_lag1","amount_avg_lag2","amount_avg_lag3",
    "amount_stddev_lag1","refund_rate_lag1","desc_count_lag1",
    "log_amount_sum_lag1","log_amount_sum_lag2","log_amount_sum_lag3",
    "log_amount_sum_lag12","tx_count_lag12",
    "amount_avg_roll3","tx_count_roll3","amount_avg_roll6","tx_count_roll6",
    "amount_avg_roll12","tx_count_roll12",
    "amount_trend","log_amount_sum_roll12",
    "month_sin","month_cos","year_norm",
    "avg_client_mean_tx","avg_client_std_tx","avg_client_tx_count",
    "amount_growth_1_2","amount_diff_1_2"
]

existing_features = [c for c in feature_cols if c in train_pd.columns and c in holdout_pd.columns]
missing = set(feature_cols) - set(existing_features)
if missing:
    print("Warning: some features are missing and will be ignored:", missing)

X_train = train_pd[existing_features].values.astype(np.float32)
y_train = train_pd["log_amount_sum"].values.astype(np.float32)
X_hold = holdout_pd[existing_features].values.astype(np.float32)
y_hold = holdout_pd["log_amount_sum"].values.astype(np.float32)

print("Shapes -> X_train:", X_train.shape, "X_hold:", X_hold.shape)

# -------------------------
# 7) Optuna hyperparam tuning (walk-forward internal folds inside train 2015-2018)
# -------------------------
train_years = sorted(train_pd["year"].unique())
internal_folds = []
for i in range(len(train_years)-1):
    train_year_list = train_years[:i+1]
    val_year = train_years[i+1]
    tr_df = train_pd[train_pd["year"].isin(train_year_list)].reset_index(drop=True)
    val_df = train_pd[train_pd["year"] == val_year].reset_index(drop=True)
    if len(tr_df) >= 50 and len(val_df) >= 10:
        internal_folds.append((tr_df, val_df))

print(f"Internal folds for Optuna: {len(internal_folds)} folds")

def evaluate_params_on_internal(params):
    rmses = []
    for tr_df, val_df in internal_folds:
        Xtr = tr_df[existing_features].values.astype(np.float32)
        ytr = tr_df["log_amount_sum"].values.astype(np.float32)
        Xv = val_df[existing_features].values.astype(np.float32)
        yv = val_df["log_amount_sum"].values.astype(np.float32)

        dtrain = lgb.Dataset(Xtr, label=ytr)
        dval = lgb.Dataset(Xv, label=yv, reference=dtrain)
        params_local = params.copy()
        params_local["verbosity"] = -1

        model = lgb.train(
            params_local,
            dtrain,
            valid_sets=[dval],
            num_boost_round=800,
            callbacks=[lgb.early_stopping(stopping_rounds=60, verbose=False)]
        )
        preds = model.predict(Xv, num_iteration=model.best_iteration)
        rmses.append(math.sqrt(mean_squared_error(yv, preds)))
    return float(np.mean(rmses)) if len(rmses)>0 else float("inf")

def optuna_objective(trial):
    params = {
        "objective":"regression",
        "metric":"rmse",
        "boosting_type":"gbdt",
        "learning_rate": trial.suggest_float("learning_rate", 0.005, 0.15, log=True),
        "num_leaves": trial.suggest_int("num_leaves", 15, 256),
        "max_depth": trial.suggest_int("max_depth", 3, 16),
        "min_child_samples": trial.suggest_int("min_child_samples", 5, 120),
        "subsample": trial.suggest_float("subsample", 0.3, 1.0),
        "colsample_bytree": trial.suggest_float("colsample_bytree", 0.3, 1.0),
        "lambda_l1": trial.suggest_float("lambda_l1", 0.0, 20.0),
        "lambda_l2": trial.suggest_float("lambda_l2", 0.0, 20.0),
    }
    return evaluate_params_on_internal(params)

print("Starting Optuna (walk-forward inside train 2015-2018). This can take time.")
study = optuna.create_study(direction="minimize")
study.optimize(optuna_objective, n_trials=25, show_progress_bar=True)
best_params = study.best_params
print("Best params from Optuna:", best_params)

final_lgb_params = {
    "objective":"regression",
    "metric":"rmse",
    "boosting_type":"gbdt",
    "verbosity":-1,
    **best_params
}

# -------------------------
# 8) Train final LightGBM on full train (2015-2018)
# -------------------------
dtrain_full = lgb.Dataset(X_train, label=y_train)
dhold = lgb.Dataset(X_hold, label=y_hold, reference=dtrain_full)

print("Training final LightGBM on 2015-2018 ...")
final_model = lgb.train(final_lgb_params, dtrain_full, valid_sets=[dhold],
                        num_boost_round=1200, callbacks=[lgb.early_stopping(stopping_rounds=80, verbose=False)])

# Holdout predictions (main)
pred_hold_main = final_model.predict(X_hold, num_iteration=final_model.best_iteration)
rmse_main = math.sqrt(mean_squared_error(y_hold, pred_hold_main))
mae_main = mean_absolute_error(y_hold, pred_hold_main)
r2_main = r2_score(y_hold, pred_hold_main)
print(f"MAIN on 2019 -> RMSE: {rmse_main:.4f}, MAE: {mae_main:.4f}, R2: {r2_main:.4f}")

# -------------------------
# 9) Build residuals on training history (2015-2018) for ARIMA candidates
# -------------------------
train_pd = train_pd.reset_index(drop=True)
train_pd["pred_main_train"] = final_model.predict(train_pd[existing_features].values.astype(np.float32),
                                                  num_iteration=final_model.best_iteration)
train_pd["residual_train"] = train_pd["log_amount_sum"].values - train_pd["pred_main_train"].values

# Build monthly residual time series per merchant
merchant_hist = {}
for mid, g in train_pd.groupby("merchant_id"):
    g_sorted = g.sort_values(["year", "month"]).reset_index(drop=True)
    idx = pd.to_datetime(
        g_sorted["year"].astype(int).astype(str) +
        g_sorted["month"].astype(int).astype(str).str.zfill(2) + "01",
        format="%Y%m%d"
    )
    s = pd.Series(g_sorted["residual_train"].values, index=idx)
    full_idx = pd.date_range(start=s.index.min(), end=s.index.max(), freq="MS")
    s = s.reindex(full_idx).fillna(0.0)
    merchant_hist[mid] = s

# -------------------------
# 10) Prepare holdout set properly with merchant_id in index
# -------------------------
holdout_pd = holdout_pd.reset_index(drop=True)

holdout_pd["ym_dt"] = pd.to_datetime(
    holdout_pd["year"].astype(int).astype(str) +
    holdout_pd["month"].astype(int).astype(str).str.zfill(2) + "01",
    format="%Y%m%d"
)
holdout_pd["y_true"] = y_hold
holdout_pd["pred_main"] = pred_hold_main

# -------------------------
# 11) Evaluate ARIMA correction per merchant - CORRECTION ICI
# -------------------------
min_hist_periods = 18
arima_order = (1, 0, 1)
merchant_use_arima = {}
merchant_models = {}

print("Evaluating ARIMA per merchant on holdout ...")

# Crer un dictionnaire pour stocker les corrections ARIMA par (merchant_id, date)
arima_corrections = {}

for mid, group in tqdm(holdout_pd.groupby("merchant_id", sort=False), desc="ARIMA evaluation"):
    hist_series = merchant_hist.get(mid)
    if hist_series is None or len(hist_series) < min_hist_periods:
        merchant_use_arima[mid] = False
        continue

    # CORRECTION: Utiliser les valeurs directement au lieu des index
    group_reset = group.reset_index(drop=True)

    if len(group_reset) == 0:
        merchant_use_arima[mid] = False
        continue

    try:
        model = ARIMA(hist_series, order=arima_order)
        res = model.fit(method_kwargs={"warn_convergence": False})

        hold_dates = pd.to_datetime(group_reset["ym_dt"].values)
        last_hist_date = hist_series.index.max()
        months_ahead_list = ((hold_dates.year - last_hist_date.year) * 12 +
                             (hold_dates.month - last_hist_date.month)).astype(int)
        max_ahead = int(np.max(months_ahead_list)) if len(months_ahead_list)>0 else 0
        if max_ahead <= 0:
            merchant_use_arima[mid] = False
            continue

        fc = res.forecast(steps=max_ahead)
        local_fc = np.array([float(fc[int(ma)-1]) if int(ma)>0 and int(ma)-1 < len(fc) else 0.0
                    for ma in months_ahead_list])

        # Rcuprer les prdictions pour ce groupe
        preds_before = group_reset["pred_main"].values
        preds_after = preds_before + local_fc

        y_true_group = group_reset["y_true"].values
        rmse_before = math.sqrt(mean_squared_error(y_true_group, preds_before))
        rmse_after = math.sqrt(mean_squared_error(y_true_group, preds_after))

        use_arima = rmse_after < rmse_before
        merchant_use_arima[mid] = use_arima

        if use_arima:
            merchant_models[mid] = res
            # Stocker les corrections pour ce merchant
            for i, date in enumerate(hold_dates):
                arima_corrections[(mid, date)] = local_fc[i]

    except Exception as e:
        merchant_use_arima[mid] = False
        print(f"Error for merchant {mid}: {e}")

n_selected = sum(merchant_use_arima.values())
print(f"ARIMA applied for {n_selected} merchants out of {len(merchant_use_arima)}")

# -------------------------
# 12) Apply ARIMA corrections on holdout - CORRECTION ICI
# -------------------------
residual_corr_hold = np.zeros(len(holdout_pd), dtype=float)
pred_hold_final = holdout_pd["pred_main"].copy()

for i, row in holdout_pd.iterrows():
    mid = row["merchant_id"]
    date = row["ym_dt"]

    # Rcuprer la correction si elle existe
    correction = arima_corrections.get((mid, date), 0.0)
    residual_corr_hold[i] = correction
    pred_hold_final.iloc[i] += correction

# -------------------------
# 13) Evaluate hybrid model
# -------------------------
y_pred_hybrid_hold = pred_hold_final.values
rmse_hybrid = math.sqrt(mean_squared_error(holdout_pd["y_true"].values, y_pred_hybrid_hold))
mae_hybrid = mean_absolute_error(holdout_pd["y_true"].values, y_pred_hybrid_hold)
r2_hybrid = r2_score(holdout_pd["y_true"].values, y_pred_hybrid_hold)

print("\n" + "="*60)
print("FINAL RESULTS")
print("="*60)
print(f"MAIN (LightGBM only) -> RMSE={rmse_main:.4f}, MAE={mae_main:.4f}, R2={r2_main:.4f}")
print(f"HYBRID (ARIMA-corrected) -> RMSE={rmse_hybrid:.4f}, MAE={mae_hybrid:.4f}, R2={r2_hybrid:.4f}")
improvement = ((rmse_main - rmse_hybrid) / rmse_main * 100) if rmse_main > 0 else 0
print(f"Improvement: {improvement:.2f}%")

holdout_pd["y_pred_main"] = holdout_pd["pred_main"].values
holdout_pd["residual_corr_arima"] = residual_corr_hold
holdout_pd["y_pred_hybrid"] = y_pred_hybrid_hold

# Reconvertir en dollars pour Power BI
holdout_pd["amount_actual_dollars"] = np.exp(holdout_pd["y_true"]) - 1
holdout_pd["amount_pred_main_dollars"] = np.exp(holdout_pd["y_pred_main"]) - 1
holdout_pd["amount_pred_hybrid_dollars"] = np.exp(holdout_pd["y_pred_hybrid"]) - 1

holdout_pd.to_csv("holdout_2019_results.csv", index=False)
print("\n Exported holdout_2019_results.csv")

# Feature importance
importance = final_model.feature_importance(importance_type='gain')
feature_importance_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'feature': existing_features,
    'importance': importance
}).sort_values('importance', ascending=False)

print("\nTop 15 Feature Importances:")
print(feature_importance_df.head(15))
feature_importance_df.to_csv("feature_importance.csv", index=False)
print(" Exported feature_importance.csv")


# ===============================
# SECTION 14: PRODUCTION - PRDICTIONS NOV 2019  OCT 2020
# ===============================

print("\n" + "="*60)
print("PRODUCTION: GENERATING PREDICTIONS FOR NOV 2019 - OCT 2020")
print("="*60)

# -------------------------
# 14.1) Training all data on the period (2015-2019)
# -------------------------
print("\n[Step 1/5] Training final model on all data (2015-2019)...")

train_full_ym_max = 2019 * 100 + 10
train_full_agg = agg.filter(col("ym") <= train_full_ym_max).cache()

print(f"Full training set rows: {train_full_agg.count():,}")

# Data aggregation
train_full_date_max = "2019-10-31"
train_full_transactions = df.filter(col("date") <= lit(train_full_date_max)).cache()

client_stats_full = train_full_transactions.groupBy("client_id").agg(
    _avg("log_amount_sum_tx").alias("client_mean_tx"),
    _stddev("log_amount_sum_tx").alias("client_std_tx"),
    _count("*").alias("client_tx_count")
).fillna({"client_std_tx": 0.0})

tx_with_client_full = train_full_transactions.join(client_stats_full, "client_id", "left")
client_agg_df_full = tx_with_client_full.groupBy("merchant_id","ym").agg(
    _avg("client_mean_tx").alias("avg_client_mean_tx"),
    _avg("client_std_tx").alias("avg_client_std_tx"),
    _avg("client_tx_count").alias("avg_client_tx_count")
)

train_full_joined = train_full_agg.join(client_agg_df_full, ["merchant_id","ym"], "left").fillna({
    "avg_client_mean_tx":0.0,"avg_client_std_tx":0.0,"avg_client_tx_count":0.0
})

# Convert to pandas
train_full_pd = train_full_joined.toPandas().fillna(0.0).reset_index(drop=True)
print(f"Converted to pandas: {len(train_full_pd):,} rows")

X_train_full = train_full_pd[existing_features].values.astype(np.float32)
y_train_full = train_full_pd["log_amount_sum"].values.astype(np.float32)

# Train the model with LightGBM
dtrain_full_final = lgb.Dataset(X_train_full, label=y_train_full)

print("Training final LightGBM model...")
final_production_model = lgb.train(
    final_lgb_params,
    dtrain_full_final,
    num_boost_round=1200,
)

print("Model trained successfully!")

# -------------------------
# 14.2) Build residual with ARIMA
# -------------------------
print("\n[Step 2/5] Building ARIMA residuals on full history (2015-2019)...")

train_full_pd["pred_main_full"] = final_production_model.predict(
    train_full_pd[existing_features].values.astype(np.float32)
)
train_full_pd["residual_full"] = train_full_pd["log_amount_sum"].values - train_full_pd["pred_main_full"].values

# Build temporal serie per merchant
merchant_hist_full = {}
for mid, g in tqdm(train_full_pd.groupby("merchant_id"), desc="Building residual series"):
    g_sorted = g.sort_values(["year", "month"]).reset_index(drop=True)
    idx = pd.to_datetime(
        g_sorted["year"].astype(int).astype(str) +
        g_sorted["month"].astype(int).astype(str).str.zfill(2) + "01",
        format="%Y%m%d"
    )
    s = pd.Series(g_sorted["residual_full"].values, index=idx)
    full_idx = pd.date_range(start=s.index.min(), end=s.index.max(), freq="MS")
    s = s.reindex(full_idx).fillna(0.0)
    merchant_hist_full[mid] = s

print(f"Built residual series for {len(merchant_hist_full):,} merchants")

# -------------------------
# 14.3) Train ARIMA model for each merchant
# -------------------------
print("\n[Step 3/5] Training ARIMA models per merchant...")

min_hist_periods = 18
arima_order = (1, 0, 1)
merchant_arima_models = {}

for mid, hist_series in tqdm(merchant_hist_full.items(), desc="Training ARIMA"):
    if len(hist_series) < min_hist_periods:
        continue

    try:
        model = ARIMA(hist_series, order=arima_order)
        res = model.fit(method_kwargs={"warn_convergence": False})
        merchant_arima_models[mid] = res
    except Exception as e:
        pass

print(f"Trained ARIMA models for {len(merchant_arima_models):,} merchants")

# -------------------------
# 14.4) Creation of the prediction dataset for the period Nov 2019 - Oct 2020
# -------------------------
print("\n[Step 4/5] Creating prediction dataset for Nov 2019 - Oct 2020...")

# Define the prediction period
pred_start_ym = 2019 * 100 + 11  # Nov 2019
pred_end_ym = 2020 * 100 + 10    # Oct 2020

# Creation of a list of merchants which have data in 2019
merchants_active = train_full_pd[train_full_pd["year"] == 2019]["merchant_id"].unique()
print(f"Active merchants in 2019: {len(merchants_active):,}")

# Last known values for each merchant
last_known_values = train_full_pd.groupby("merchant_id").last().reset_index()

# Predioction list creation
prediction_rows = []

for target_year in [2019, 2020]:
    start_month = 11 if target_year == 2019 else 1
    end_month = 12 if target_year == 2019 else 10

    for target_month in range(start_month, end_month + 1):
        target_ym = target_year * 100 + target_month

        print(f"  Creating rows for {target_year}-{target_month:02d}...")

        for merchant_id in merchants_active:
            merchant_data = last_known_values[last_known_values["merchant_id"] == merchant_id]

            if len(merchant_data) == 0:
                continue

            merchant_row = merchant_data.iloc[0]

            # Creation of the features for the prediction
            # LAGs are based on the last knows values (for simplification)
            row_dict = {
                "merchant_id": merchant_id,
                "year": target_year,
                "month": target_month,
                "ym": target_ym,

                # LAG features
                "tx_count_lag1": merchant_row.get("tx_count", 0),
                "tx_count_lag2": merchant_row.get("tx_count_lag1", 0),
                "tx_count_lag3": merchant_row.get("tx_count_lag2", 0),
                "amount_avg_lag1": merchant_row.get("amount_avg", 0),
                "amount_avg_lag2": merchant_row.get("amount_avg_lag1", 0),
                "amount_avg_lag3": merchant_row.get("amount_avg_lag2", 0),
                "amount_stddev_lag1": merchant_row.get("amount_stddev", 0),
                "refund_rate_lag1": merchant_row.get("refund_rate", 0),
                "desc_count_lag1": merchant_row.get("desc_count", 0),
                "log_amount_sum_lag1": merchant_row.get("log_amount_sum", 0),
                "log_amount_sum_lag2": merchant_row.get("log_amount_sum_lag1", 0),
                "log_amount_sum_lag3": merchant_row.get("log_amount_sum_lag2", 0),
                "log_amount_sum_lag12": merchant_row.get("log_amount_sum_lag12", 0),
                "tx_count_lag12": merchant_row.get("tx_count_lag12", 0),

                # Rolling features
                "amount_avg_roll3": merchant_row.get("amount_avg_roll3", 0),
                "tx_count_roll3": merchant_row.get("tx_count_roll3", 0),
                "amount_avg_roll6": merchant_row.get("amount_avg_roll6", 0),
                "tx_count_roll6": merchant_row.get("tx_count_roll6", 0),
                "amount_avg_roll12": merchant_row.get("amount_avg_roll12", 0),
                "tx_count_roll12": merchant_row.get("tx_count_roll12", 0),
                "log_amount_sum_roll12": merchant_row.get("log_amount_sum_roll12", 0),

                # Trend
                "amount_trend": merchant_row.get("amount_trend", 0),

                # Temporal features
                "month_sin": np.sin(2 * np.pi * target_month / 12),
                "month_cos": np.cos(2 * np.pi * target_month / 12),
                "year_norm": target_year - min_year,  # min_year dfini plus haut (2015)

                # Client features
                "avg_client_mean_tx": merchant_row.get("avg_client_mean_tx", 0),
                "avg_client_std_tx": merchant_row.get("avg_client_std_tx", 0),
                "avg_client_tx_count": merchant_row.get("avg_client_tx_count", 0),

                # Growth/diff features
                "amount_growth_1_2": merchant_row.get("amount_growth_1_2", 1.0),
                "amount_diff_1_2": merchant_row.get("amount_diff_1_2", 0.0),
            }

            prediction_rows.append(row_dict)

# Prediction DataFrame creation
prediction_df = pd.DataFrame(prediction_rows)
print(f"Created prediction dataset: {len(prediction_df):,} rows")
print(f"   Covering {prediction_df['ym'].nunique()} months for {prediction_df['merchant_id'].nunique():,} merchants")

# -------------------------
# 14.5) Generate prediction with LightGBM + ARIMA
# -------------------------
print("\n[Step 5/5] Generating predictions (LightGBM + ARIMA)...")

# Prediction using LightGBM
X_pred = prediction_df[existing_features].values.astype(np.float32)
pred_lgbm = final_production_model.predict(X_pred)

prediction_df["pred_lgbm_log"] = pred_lgbm
prediction_df["pred_lgbm"] = np.exp(pred_lgbm) - 1  # chelle originale

# Correction using ARIMA
prediction_df["ym_dt"] = pd.to_datetime(
    prediction_df["year"].astype(int).astype(str) +
    prediction_df["month"].astype(int).astype(str).str.zfill(2) + "01",
    format="%Y%m%d"
)

prediction_df["arima_correction"] = 0.0
prediction_df["pred_hybrid_log"] = prediction_df["pred_lgbm_log"].copy()

print("Applying ARIMA corrections...")
for mid, group in tqdm(prediction_df.groupby("merchant_id", sort=False), desc="ARIMA corrections"):
    if mid not in merchant_arima_models:
        continue

    try:
        arima_model = merchant_arima_models[mid]
        last_hist_date = merchant_hist_full[mid].index.max()

        for idx in group.index:
            row = prediction_df.loc[idx]
            months_ahead = (row["ym_dt"].year - last_hist_date.year) * 12 + \
                           (row["ym_dt"].month - last_hist_date.month)

            if months_ahead > 0:
                fc = arima_model.forecast(steps=int(months_ahead))
                corr = float(fc[-1]) if len(fc) > 0 else 0.0
                prediction_df.loc[idx, "arima_correction"] = corr
                prediction_df.loc[idx, "pred_hybrid_log"] = prediction_df.loc[idx, "pred_lgbm_log"] + corr
    except Exception as e:
        pass

prediction_df["pred_hybrid"] = np.exp(prediction_df["pred_hybrid_log"]) - 1

# -------------------------
# 14.6) Export of results
# -------------------------
print("\n" + "="*60)
print("PRODUCTION PREDICTIONS SUMMARY")
print("="*60)

print(f"Total predictions: {len(prediction_df):,}")
print(f"Period: {prediction_df['ym'].min()} to {prediction_df['ym'].max()}")
print(f"Merchants covered: {prediction_df['merchant_id'].nunique():,}")
print(f"ARIMA corrections applied: {(prediction_df['arima_correction'] != 0).sum():,} rows")

print("\nMonthly aggregated predictions:")
monthly_summary = prediction_df.groupby("ym").agg({
    "pred_lgbm": "sum",
    "pred_hybrid": "sum",
    "merchant_id": "nunique"
}).rename(columns={"merchant_id": "n_merchants"})
print(monthly_summary)

print("\nTotal predicted amounts:")
print(f"  LightGBM only: ${prediction_df['pred_lgbm'].sum():,.2f}")
print(f"  Hybrid (ARIMA): ${prediction_df['pred_hybrid'].sum():,.2f}")
print(f"  Average per merchant per month: ${prediction_df['pred_hybrid'].mean():,.2f}")

# Select columns for the export
export_cols = [
    "merchant_id", "year", "month", "ym", "ym_dt",
    "pred_lgbm", "pred_hybrid", "pred_lgbm_log", "pred_hybrid_log",
    "arima_correction"
] + existing_features

prediction_export = prediction_df[export_cols]

# Export
output_file = "production_predictions_nov2019_oct2020.csv"
prediction_export.to_csv(output_file, index=False)
print(f"\n Exported production predictions -> {output_file}")

# Export of the monthly result per merchant
monthly_merchant_summary = prediction_df.groupby(["merchant_id", "year", "month"]).agg({
    "pred_lgbm": "sum",
    "pred_hybrid": "sum",
    "ym": "first"
}).reset_index()

monthly_merchant_summary.to_csv("production_predictions_monthly_summary.csv", index=False)
print(f" Exported monthly summary -> production_predictions_monthly_summary.csv")

# Stats per merchant
merchant_stats = prediction_df.groupby("merchant_id").agg({
    "pred_hybrid": ["sum", "mean", "std"],
    "month": "count"
}).reset_index()
merchant_stats.columns = ["merchant_id", "total_predicted", "avg_monthly", "std_monthly", "n_months"]
merchant_stats = merchant_stats.sort_values("total_predicted", ascending=False)

merchant_stats.to_csv("production_merchant_statistics.csv", index=False)
print(f" Exported merchant statistics -> production_merchant_statistics.csv")

print("\n" + "="*60)
print("PRODUCTION PREDICTIONS COMPLETED!")
print("="*60)

# Cleanup
train_full_agg.unpersist()
train_full_transactions.unpersist()

[I 2025-11-08 14:08:04,766] Trial 4 finished with value: 0.8216278175033157 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.009756129370590968, 'num_leaves': 105, 'max_depth': 5, 'min_child_samples': 23, 'subsample': 0.8725958891207519, 'colsample_bytree': 0.6447965005420913, 'lambda_l1': 10.888965427075512, 'lambda_l2': 19.269703568718263}. Best is trial 3 with value: 0.8143337230187169.
[I 2025-11-08 14:09:11,870] Trial 5 finished with value: 0.8166394395100275 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.09758136910928251, 'num_leaves': 60, 'max_depth': 5, 'min_child_samples': 13, 'subsample': 0.6048900954498513, 'colsample_bytree': 0.7163760821657805, 'lambda_l1': 16.052959651848777, 'lambda_l2': 0.7747344380197974}. Best is trial 3 with value: 0.8143337230187169.
[I 2025-11-08 14:11:25,266] Trial 6 finished with value: 0.8159918131638948 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.01600738221968888, 'num_leaves': 162, 'max_depth': 7, 'min_child_samples': 53, 'subsample': 0.47009121003669085, 'colsample_bytree': 0.8886927799388797, 'lambda_l1': 0.4818230384654054, 'lambda_l2': 11.760340735954935}. [I 2025-11-08 14:13:26,518] Trial 7 finished with value: 0.8210529527701196 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.0064933861237727215, 'num_leaves': 214, 'max_depth': 6, 'min_child_samples': 7, 'subsample': 0.5032241534942612, 'colsample_bytree': 0.8433004284807661, 'lambda_l1': 18.072035863548, 'lambda_l2': 8.206959576256134}. [I 2025-11-08 14:14:48,939] Trial 8 finished with value: 0.8224253916756528 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.014927588932486741, 'num_leaves': 229, 'max_depth': 4, 'min_child_samples': 37, 'subsample': 0.752779696454632, 'colsample_bytree': 0.5890811404675148, 'lambda_l1': 6.938413082668009, 'lambda_l2': 2.7970957081459336}. [I 2025-11-08 14:16:09,323] Trial 9 finished with value: 0.8168869079717963 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.05158622304212649, 'num_leaves': 93, 'max_depth': 5, 'min_child_samples': 69, 'subsample': 0.5135787463291281, 'colsample_bytree': 0.9187326064136481, 'lambda_l1': 13.19443704884475, 'lambda_l2': 12.26553436043803}. [I 2025-11-08 14:16:57,171] Trial 10 finished with value: 0.8191214652287382 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.1497072888298948, 'num_leaves': 21, 'max_depth': 16, 'min_child_samples': 102, 'subsample': 0.3821307509885886, 'colsample_bytree': 0.3218699300607679, 'lambda_l1': 6.047041169588558, 'lambda_l2': 15.494141407946069}. [I 2025-11-08 14:19:03,286] Trial 11 finished with value: 0.8149797278797042 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.0369325436145289, 'num_leaves': 193, 'max_depth': 16, 'min_child_samples': 103, 'subsample': 0.3258822307724745, 'colsample_bytree': 0.41694284100051726, 'lambda_l1': 5.680764850347031, 'lambda_l2': 6.902854218069329}. Best is trial 3 with value: 0.8143337230187169.
[I 2025-11-08 14:20:51,070] Trial 12 finished with value: 0.8149699308755455 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.04295069257819051, 'num_leaves': 245, 'max_depth': 13, 'min_child_samples': 117, 'subsample': 0.9930868923502204, 'colsample_bytree': 0.4985170155260645, 'lambda_l1': 1.9014828969993918, 'lambda_l2': 6.397644385740053}. Best is trial 3 with value: 0.8143337230187169.
[I 2025-11-08 14:23:06,022] Trial 13 finished with value: 0.8144720397983951 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.025538256919086882, 'num_leaves': 173, 'max_depth': 13, 'min_child_samples': 87, 'subsample': 0.8140816570788153, 'colsample_bytree': 0.5291791975849497, 'lambda_l1': 8.025128057106691, 'lambda_l2': 10.02888719132519}. Best is trial 3 with value: 0.8143337230187169.
[I 2025-11-08 14:25:30,949] Trial 14 finished with value: 0.8149445198885833 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.022828991802064904, 'num_leaves': 170, 'max_depth': 13, 'min_child_samples': 85, 'subsample': 0.8169324544664571, 'colsample_bytree': 0.9995022680920486, 'lambda_l1': 8.870470324340191, 'lambda_l2': 10.644051211494196}. Best is trial 3 with value: 0.8143337230187169.
[I 2025-11-08 14:27:00,456] Trial 15 finished with value: 0.8150830643575411 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.06434197546583874, 'num_leaves': 180, 'max_depth': 13, 'min_child_samples': 85, 'subsample': 0.637916893208013, 'colsample_bytree': 0.544738835390649, 'lambda_l1': 13.754428649470759, 'lambda_l2': 15.697970179285782}. Best is trial 3 with value: 0.8143337230187169.
[I 2025-11-08 14:29:07,885] Trial 16 finished with value: 0.8143784160166619 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.02390446217776206, 'num_leaves': 135, 'max_depth': 11, 'min_child_samples': 65, 'subsample': 0.5765015676840041, 'colsample_bytree': 0.6614659412291966, 'lambda_l1': 3.4688127578824357, 'lambda_l2': 14.019913452215564}. Best is trial 3 with value: 0.8143337230187169.
[I 2025-11-08 14:30:19,680] Trial 17 finished with value: 0.8148472287125457 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.05885257034675632, 'num_leaves': 134, 'max_depth': 10, 'min_child_samples': 65, 'subsample': 0.5667594360275297, 'colsample_bytree': 0.688486851731982, 'lambda_l1': 2.731963276109443, 'lambda_l2': 14.183279352651148}. Best is trial 3 with value: 0.8143337230187169.
[I 2025-11-08 14:32:33,240] Trial 18 finished with value: 0.8151921599754021 and parameters: {'learning_rate': 0.020106587206859983, 'num_leaves': 131, 'max_depth': 8, 'min_child_samples': 45, 'subsample': 0.42667567629082154, 'colsample_bytree': 0.6246584674243093, 'lambda_l1': 3.619893524413124, 'lambda_l2': 13.53221159716273}. Best is trial 3 with value: 0.8143337230187169.
